definition: a chord (see chord entry 3 sense 2) passing through the center of a figure or body
the length of a straight line through the center of an object or space
examples: dug a hole nearly four feet in diameter

definition: a unit of enlargement used with a number to indicate magnification by a lens or optical system
examples: an object one millimeter wide magnified 40 diameters appears 40 millimeters wide
